title: Origin of Master Yi Alpha Bug
body:
Getting pretty tired of the bug and it seems Riot has no idea what caused it so I'll just mention when it came into existence.

When Alpha striking Master Yi still gets hit by projectiles & AoE a lot of the time, refer here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LimM9a2ajE4

Obviously not every single one was a bug but there are a lot of ridiculous alphas and people are noticing and complaining.

Here is Master Yi without an alpha bug:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pf9yJM4bbQw

He has a completely different feel to him, and was predictable. You could only dodge projectiles at the END of the projectile cast as it was about to hit you. Now you can "dodge it" anytime. Sometimes. I guess? Its not predictable anymore, like it used to be.

The bug started happening when you guys implemented those dumb patience bars onto the camps and Master Yi's alpha strike made the patience bars reset. You guys "fixed" the patience bars from resetting but in exchange Master Yi gets wrecked in alpha. I'm assuming he no longer "disappears" or something which explains why he can randomly get hit, so the mobs don't think he disappeared.

Hopefully using the origin of the bug someone can finally fix it. It'd be worth having the monsters deplete their patience bars... If you guys, you know, want to revert it.

Pls its been too long. {{champion:11}}

replies.body:
tldr; Fix in progress... 90% fixed, still need more time to work on it.

From my investigations, it has nothing to do with patience timers. It might have been there since he was released, but probably no one was good enough to have noticed it back then. The bug, as far as i understand,  is that there is a 2 server frame delay on when the un-targetability state is applied, like 10~50 milliseconds.

This bug is extremely time consuming to fix.... To fix this, we'll need to rewrite the entire ability and architect the spell logic correctly. This means that we'll need to retest everything with this ability. This is essentially 25% of the QA work needed to release a new champion, and more since we need to ensure it looks, sounds, and feels just the same on all skins (and Master Yi have a lot of skins). On top of that, we need to verify a bug that exists for about 10~50 milliseconds, which is really bloody time consuming.

The fix I attempted went out to PBE in 6.13, and had 1 failure. I'm currently in the tail of a project, and do have no time to readdress the issues until it ships. There's a lot of moving parts in Alpha Strike, and I can't garen-tee the fix will be identical in feels to an experienced Master YI player, your feedback will be appreciated when that rolls around. 

Cheers,

Exgeniar

I already spent about 12 hours on work on this bug, I'm not going to throw away 12 hours of my life for nothing.

Howdy,  I've been playing Yi since 2011.  This is a recent problem that started in patch 5.18.

I believe it is related to [Disappearing missiles fix](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-518-notes#patch-disappearing-missiles-fix)

>  This time, we’re addressing a bug where the game client (your computer) could incorrectly cancel a spell that still existed on the server. This led to cases where a spell could briefly appear on screen and then immediately visually disappear, but still be able to hit enemies.


Quote 2

> Basically, the server’s cancel command was too generic - rather than “stop this thing”, it just told the game client to “stop a thing”. In cases where multiple similar actions were happening in extremely rapid succession, the game client had to guess at what the server was trying to stop, and this bug happened when it guessed wrong.


My guess is that prior to 5.18 alpha would cancel every effect of a targetted spell, even when it is en route.

After 5.18 the avoidance is handled server-side.  When determining which effect has precedence it is using the <begin cast> time.

For example TF casts yellow card.  Yi alpha strikes when the projectile is in the air.

This causes Yi to show the alphastrike animation.  However, since yellow card was cast before alphastrike, the stun effect registers.

Perhaps adding projectile  speed * distance to the <begin cast> when adjudicating the event log would resolve this.

Or code a mini-timewinder ability to alphastrike.  When yi exits alphastrike return his health/status/buffs/debuffs to what they were when alphastrike was first cast and ignore any effects applied to him for alphastrike's duration.

Does this mean the workaround is to use Alpha Strike ~50ms earlier than you would need to if Alpha Strike performed reliably?
90% of the cases yes. Pretty sure there are a few cases where certain abilities do not respect untargetability, and those are bugs against those abilities.
Cho'Gath's W. Although the problem with that is that if you're 'hit' while Cho'Gath is casting it, you're hit if you flash, or even if you alpha strike.

This may not be bug but behaviour mistake. Annie's flamecone was doing the same and they "modified" it during her Midyear Update. When someone pointed out it's ridiculous this "bug" wasn't "fixed" for like 7 years, Rioter (I think Meddler) said it is not literally bug as it was doing what it was supposed to do but they changed the design point of view about it. Since Cho'Gath is outdated, it may be the case for him, too.

Also both abilities are cast-time cone-based ability so they may be based on the same core code.

Yeah. Cho's and Annie's W were designed to acquire target on cast start, and will still damage targets that are untargetable at the end of the cast. So that's not a bug. (a lot of other cone abilities have this behaviour too)

Hey Exgeniar, just wanted to let you know that we all appreciate your work to fix this alpha bug! This has been plaguing us Yi mains for a long time now, and even made many give up on maining him.

Whenever you have your fix ready to test or need anything from Yi mains, just make a post on https://www.reddit.com/r/yimo, the largest Yi main community in the world. It is actually a really active subreddit and we'll respond right away if you need anything from us.

Thanks again, keep up the good work and thanks for working hard for us!
